    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the stream. After closing, the size of the data written to the stream is calculated and saved as metadata on the content object (can subsequently be retrieved from the size field). Users of this class should make sure to always call close() and not rely on the finalizer.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Overrides:
        close in class java.io.FileOutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • getContentId

        public java.lang.Long getContentId()
        Returns the id of the created content object.

      • getApproval

        public Approval getApproval()
        Returns the approval for the created content object. See ContentService.createApproval(Content, Integer).

        public java.lang.String toString()
